intro: Scaphochlamys salahuddiniana, commonly known as the Sahel candelabra, is a flowering plant native to the Sahel region of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its unique candelabra-like branching structure. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
